Class CompanyRepRepository

java.lang.Object
database.CompanyRepRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
CrudRepository<CompanyRep, String>
public class CompanyRepRepository extends Object implements CrudRepository<CompanyRep, String>
In-memory repository for managing CompanyRep entities.

This repository provides CRUD operations for company representative records and supports CSV-based persistence. Company representatives are uniquely identified by their email address, which serves as the primary key for all operations.

The repository maintains case-insensitive email handling and provides CSV load/save functionality with flexible header parsing. The CSV schema includes comprehensive company representative information including approval status and rejection reasons.

      public Optional<CompanyRep> findById(String email)
      Finds a company representative by their email address.

      Email matching is case-insensitive. The email is normalized to lowercase before searching.

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      email - the email address to search for
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the found representative, or empty if not found

    • save

      public CompanyRep save(CompanyRep rep)
      Saves a company representative to the repository.

      If a representative with the same email already exists, it will be replaced. The email address is normalized to lowercase for storage.

      Specified by:
      save in interface CrudRepository<CompanyRep, String>
      Parameters:
      rep - the company representative to save
      Returns:
      the saved company representative
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the representative is null

    • saveToCsv

      public void saveToCsv(String path) throws IOException
      Saves all company representatives to a CSV file with standardized column headers.

      The CSV file is created with the following columns in this exact order:

      1. CompanyRepID - The representative's email address
      2. Name - The representative's full name
      3. CompanyName - The company name
      4. Department - The department within the company
      5. Position - The representative's job position
      6. Email - The email address (duplicate of CompanyRepID)
      7. Status - Approval status (PENDING, APPROVED, or REJECTED)
      8. Password - The account password
      9. RejectionReason - Reason for rejection if status is REJECTED

      Parent directories are created automatically if they don't exist. If the file already exists, it will be overwritten.

      Parameters:
      path - the output CSV file path
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the file
      SecurityException - if file access is denied

    • loadFromCsv

      public void loadFromCsv(String path) throws IOException
      Loads company representatives from a CSV file with flexible header recognition.

      The CSV file can use various column headers for each field:

      • Email/CompanyRepID: "companyrepid", "email"
      • Name: "name"
      • Company Name: "companyname"
      • Department: "department"
      • Position: "position"
      • Status: "status"
      • Password: "password"
      • Rejection Reason: "rejectionreason"

      If the email/CompanyRepID is missing from a row, that row is skipped. Missing optional fields are handled as follows:

      • Password defaults to "password" if not specified
      • Status defaults to PENDING if not specified or unrecognized
      • Rejection reason defaults to "Rejected by staff" for REJECTED status

      Supported status values: "APPROVED", "REJECTED", "PENDING" (case-insensitive)

      Parameters:
      path - the input CSV file path
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file
      SecurityException - if file access is denied
